title.native: ゴジラ S.P＜シンギュラポイント＞

description:
This series features an original story, which depicts the young geniuses Mei Kamino, a female researcher, and Yun Arikawa, a male engineer, as they take on an unprecedented threat with their companions. When danger comes up from the depths, only young geniuses Mei, Yun, and their team can face the threat in Godzilla Singular Point!

(Source: Netflix)
synonyms: ก็อดซิลล่า ปฐมบทวิบัติโลก

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

title.native: ゴジラ

name.native: マイケル・スティーブン

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/girodetakahashi)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Animates on rare occasions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

name.native: ポルカドットスティングレイ

node.description:
**[Website](https://polkadot-stingray.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/POLKA_fukuoka) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ9DY_FlqUYh45R0uSmOIgA)**

Polkadot Stingray is a Japanese rock band from Fukuoka, Japan signed under Universal Sigma.

Members:
- [Shizuku](https://anilist.co/staff/184375/Shizuku) - guitarist, vocals
- Harushi Ejima - guitarist
- Yuki Uemura - bassist
- Kazuma Mitsuyasu - drummer

Full name: Brand-new idol SHiT (Shinsei Kuso Idol, 新生クソアイドル)

A Japanese idol group that was founded in 2015 by their manager Watanabe Junnosuke.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.
**Yokomatsu Norihiko (横松紀彦)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.

Originating from [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/), which he left to join [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/) in 2007.

In 2012, Itamura succeeded [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) as the director of the Monogatari series following Oishi's decision to adapt the Kizumonogatari novels as [movies](https://anilist.co/anime/9260/). Beginning with [Nisemonogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/11597/), Itamura directed all subsequent televised installments of the series under [Akiyuki Shinbou](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/)'s supervision, and after that left Shaft in 2017.

More recently Itamura has been seen working on [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' shows, with [Vanitas no Carte](https://anilist.co/anime/131646/) being his first directorial work there.
